question.Title: June 2018 Visual Studio Code: C++ Compile Failure
question.Body:
I submitted a previous question (see: Visual Studio Code...) and have since struggled through with various checks / changes / uninstall / reinstalls. None of which are working.

I had just started running VS Code (pre-June 2018 version) and using it as my editor (defacto "IDE") for C++, and it was generating *.exe files....all perfectly according to the cookbook recipes for installation.Then, the June 2018 version was installed as an update.
And, to clean up my platform, which had another (and possibly conflicting) installation of MinGW that I was oblivious to when I started running C++ with the suggested download/installation of MinGW.

Now, despite cleanup of the Uninstalled conflicts (I consulted the vendor of the software for advice) & cleaning of the System PATH and so forth, I am still getting the message noted by another question (see link at: 'program does not exist").

Normally, the Stackoverflow routine would be to add a Comment to the thread (URL above), but as I have yet to reach a reputation score of 1500 pts, I cannot make comments.

Given the number of problems with VSCode & C++ compilation (>>not spitting out a.exe files), there seems to be some sort of systematic problem. If someone out there has a 1500+ Reputation score, would you please create a new tag: Visual Studio Code June 2018 ??
